text.0: they who lay quiet for a year the brahmans who fulfil their vows.
text.1: the frogs have lifted up their voice the voice parjanya hath inspired.
text.2: what time on these as on a dry skin lying in the pools bed the floods of heaven descended.
text.3: the music of the frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.
text.4: when at the coming of the rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted.
text.5: one seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.
text.6: each of these twain receives the other kindly while they are revelling in the flow of waters.
text.7: when the frog moistened by the rain springs forward and green and spotty both combine their voices.
text.8: when one of these repeats the others language as he who learns the lesson of the teacher.
text.9: your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.
text.10: onc is cowbellow and goatbleat the other one frog is green and one of them is spotty.
text.11: they bear one common name and yet they vary and talking modulate the voice diversely.
text.12: as brahmans sitting round the brimful vessel talk at the somarite of atiratra.
text.13: so frogs ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year the first of raintime.
text.14: these brahmans with the soma juice performing their yearlong rite have lifted up their voices.
text.15: and these adhvaryus sweating with their kettles come forth and show themselves and none are hidden.
text.16: they keep the twelve months godappointed order and never do the men neglect the season.
text.17: soon as the raintime in the year returneth these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.
text.18: cowbellow and goatbleat have granted riches and green and spotty have vouchsafed us treasure.
text.19: the frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.
